title: Pseudogenesis Productions Hub
content:

[[include :scp-wiki:theme:queerstyle]]

|caption=|width=300px]]

[[module css]]
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Play:wght@400;700&display=swap');

body {
    background: #150301;
}

#page-content :is(h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6) {
    font-family: "Vast Shadow", serif;
    font-weight: normal;
}

.queerbox_large {
    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 1em;
}

.queerbox_large hr {
    margin: 1em !important;
}

.queerbox_large .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption{
    display: none;
}

.queerbox_large .scp-image-block {
    margin: 0 1em 1em;
}

#wiki-tabview-0b15726b2dba49d4c9b6ac18f2dc404c {
    border: 4px solid var(--accent-color);
}

.yui-navset .yui-nav, .yui-navset .yui-navset-top {
    width: 100%;
}

.yui-content {
    padding-right: 1.5em !important;
    padding-left: 1.5em !important;
}

#page-content :is(p, li) {
    font-family: "Play", sansserif;
    font-weight: normal;
    font-size: 1.3em;
}

:root {
    --header-title: "Pseudogenesis Productions";
    --header-subtitle: "Life Imitates Art";
    --fade-in-delay: 0s;
}

div#extra-div-1 {
    background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/pseudogenesis-productions-hub/Curtain_Fix.jpg);
    background-position-y: top;
    height: 100%;
    background-size: contain;
}

#header h1 {
    font-size: 1.4em;
}

#header h2 {
    font-size: 1.3em !important;
}

.staticTransition {
    background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/pseudogenesis-productions-hub/Vhs_Glitch-cropped-flipped.gif);
    background-position-x: center;
    background-clip: border-box;
    width: 100%;
    height: 4em;
    overflow: hidden;
    background-size: cover;
    padding: 0em 1.5em;
    margin-left: -1.5em;
}

[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module rate]]
[[/>]]

[[=]]
[[=image Pseudogenesis_Logo_Flatter.png style="max-width:70%;"]]

+ Pseudogenesis Productions Proudly Presents:


[[/=]]
[[<]]
[[div style="border: 4px solid var(--accent-color);"]]
[[tabview]]
[[tab Synopsis]]
+ Who We Are
Pseudogenesis Productions has been a member of the Three Portlands' Theatre Community for over a decade now, having integrated themselves into the independent and creative arts world. A core team of a dedicated few, they are always willing to collaborate with new artists, take risks, and push the limits of what 'theatre' can be.

Whether it's a stage show, an experience, an installation, or something weirder -- if you are trying to make a difference in the world, Pseudogenesis Productions is right for you!

-----
+ About Us:
Pseudogenesis Productions is an anart theatre company, focused on creating immersive and innovative theatrical productions through the use of memetic and ontological anomalies. In sharp contrast to AWCY and other anart groups, Pseudogenesis Productions focuses on safe and discreet performances, immersive experiences, and the like, ensuring that any willing participant is able to experience something otherworldly, without any lasting damage to themselves.

Pseudogenesis Productions believes that change can be accomplished through helping other people understand more about the human experience. We do __not__ collaborate with larger organizations or corporations; we are about the community, and we refuse to compromise our message or morals. We are happy to collaborate with individual artists, grass-roots local businesses, in an effort to best benefit our communities.

[[/tab]]

[[/tab]]
[[tab Dramatis Personae]]
[[=]]
+ Meet The Team
[[/=]]
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="padding-left: 1em;"]]
+ Stephanie Pseudo | She/Her
++ Creative Director and Founder
-----
[[<]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block name=Stephanie_1.jpg|caption=content|width=50%|align=right]]
The mysterious creative director and founder of Pseudogenesis Productions, little is known about who they actually are. Constantly shrouded in shadows and silhouette, Stephanie naturally blends in backstage. She sets the full outline for many performances, and seem to be a major creative influence in every piece they create. She is present for every performance from the core team, having never missed one -- even if she's using a proxy.

She wants to thank the rest of Pseudogenesis for trusting in her to lead the way.
-----
= //To my sweet daughter Grace, I only wish that you could be here to see the show.//
[[/<]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="queerbox_large" style="padding-right: 1em;"]]
+ Vivienne Chen | She/Her
++ Memetics and Cognitohazards Designer
-----
[[>]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block name=VivienneChen_0.jpg|caption=content|width=50%|align=left]]
Vivienne Chen is the resident master of memetics, specializing in creating cognitohazards that create unique, detailed and isolated experiences for Pseudogenesis Productions. She believes that memetics allow for untold levels of shared understanding within theatre. Vivienne is the only member of Pseudogenesis to ever attend production locations in person, but has never been successfully, continually, held by the Foundation.

Vivienne would like to specifically __not__ thank the Foundation, as they are a bunch of idiots playing doctor, including her mother.
-----
= //The thing about having two moms is that the odds of one of them sucking goes way up. Love you Petra, and fuck you Erynn.//
[[/>]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="queerbox_large" style="padding-left: 1em;"]]
+ Solomon Baer | He/Him
++ Lead Lighting Designer/Technician
-----
[[<]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block name=Solomon_0.jpg|caption=content|width=50%|align=right]]
Former anomalous lighting engineer, Solomon Baer floundered after graduating from Deer College's anart theatre program. Growing up behind the veil, his understanding of color and light are creative, and as far from normalcy as needed. He is passionate about using light and images to enhance and create experiences, and is always looking for a new cool trick.

He wants to thank his parents for exposing him to the anomalous from a young age, and thanks Pseudogenesis for taking him in, and giving him a second family.
-----
= //I know I'm the youngest, and I bet you think I'm pretty immature. Yeah, I mean, you're probably right.//
[[/<]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="queerbox_large" style="padding-right: 1em;"]]
+ Duplo | They/Them
++ Ontokinetic Production Designer
-----
[[>]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block name=Duplo_0.jpg|caption=content|width=50%|align=left]]
Duplo is a college dropout who joined Pseudogenesis Productions so that they could create anart that didn't kill the viewer. They saw what AWCY? could do, and refused recruitment to become The Critic, a choice that they stand by every single day of their life. Duplo's real face is unknown, if they even have one; they can always be found controlling the blank mannequins that run around the theatre and take care of odd jobs. They are the master craftsperson, having shaped the very sets that you see before you.

Duplo would like to thank every member of Pseudogenesis, and each artist they have worked with; it is a delight to work with others who believe that true art causes change, without violence.
-----
= //Art is meant for the people, not for the elites. Anybody who can't see that isn't a true artist.//
[[/>]]
[[/div]]

-----
[[=]]
+ Meet Our Collaborators
[[/=]]

[[div class="queerbox_large" style="padding-left: 1em;"]]
+ Donatsiva Satisiva Salidore
+ AKA Donny |  She/Her
++ Ontokinetic Acoustics/Audio-Mixing/Music Performer and Artist
-----
[[<]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block name=Donny.png|caption=content|width=50%|align=right]]
Donny is a mysterious young woman with cat-like features who appeared to Pseudogenesis, following AWCY? stealing her family and a series of events that remain unclear. For the time being they are staying with Pseudogenesis as they find themselves in a new age, and prepare to take on the monstrous task of bringing AWCY? down to save her family.

Donny would like to thank Pseudogenesis for making her feel at home and also wants it to be known that she will be giving ice cream to every stray cat in the local area. 
-----
= //Interpretation is the most important part of art. As long as you enjoy your vision, as long as it's meaningful to you, that's always most important.//
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[/tab]]
[[tab Call for Submissions]]
So you want to write a Pseudogenesis piece? That's great! The GOI is fully open for anybody to contribute SCPs and Tales, with a GOI format coming really soon!

Pseudogenesis Productions stages a large variety of performances, however, any production by them shares a few key details:

Pseudogenesis focuses on the use of memetics and hermeneutics to create anomalous effects. While the use of ontokinetics is present in many performances, it is typically only used in the creation and manipulation of the spaces, rather than during the performances.

All attendees, performers and participants of a Pseudogenesis show are willing, and capable of stopping their experiences at any time. They refuse to force anybody to act against their will; knowing that true change only comes when somebody is ready.

Performances staged by Pseudogenesis typically involve themes of: agency and inaction, reliving uncommon experiences, understanding others through immersion into their lives, and the undercurrent fear of violence throughout the anomalous world, and within marginalized communities. Pseudogenesis focuses on giving a voice to the voiceless, and a stage to the forgotten.

-----

The main four Pseudogenesis members are always involved with a performance in some way; even if just in the creation, they touch everything with their name on it. They frequently collaborate with independent artists, and do their best to raise up the voices of those around them.

When writing a Pseudogenesis piece, the main thing to consider is //why.// What is the message behind what they created? What are they trying to accomplish? Who are they trying to help? As long as you remember this key detail, the sky is the limit for performances.

If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to [[*user Queerious]], the creator of Pseudogenesis!

[[/tab]]
[[tab Stage Tech]]

Pseudogenesis utilizes a number of shared technical or CSS component. These components are hosted on this hub, as well as the code needed for any of the more complex pieces.
-----
++ Theme(s):

Pseudogenesis pieces typically use one of the following themes, due to the inclusion of relevant code snippets and dividers. These themes are [[[Queerstyle CSS]]] and [[[Darkqueer Theme]]]. To use them, include the following snippets:

+++ Queerstyle
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@[[include :scp-wiki:theme:blankstyle]]@@
@@[[include :scp-wiki:theme:queerstyle]]@@
[[/div]]

+++ Darkqueer
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@[[include :scp-wiki:theme:blankstyle]]@@
@@[[include :scp-wiki:theme:darkqueer]]@@
[[/div]]

-----

++ Pseudogenesis Posters:

[[div class="pseudo-div"]]
[[=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/pseudogenesis-productions-hub/Pseudogenesis_Logo_Flatter.png style="max-width:70%;"]]
[[span style="font-size:10vw; line-height: 1;"]] Sense [[/span]]
[[span style="font-size:2.1em;"]] An anomalous sensory club, delivering transformative artistic experiences through immersion in an incomparable world.
[[/span]]
@@ @@
[[span style="font-size:1.1em;"]] Limited Engagement Only. Tickets available at venue.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

All performances or shows feature a poster created by the team. These are not physical posters, rather, cognitohazard stickers that //appear// to be a poster. To include one in your work, you can use the following code:

[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@[[div class="pseudo-div"]]@@
@@[[=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/pseudogenesis-productions-hub/Pseudogenesis_Logo_Flatter.png style="max-width:70%;"]]@@
@@[[span style="font-size:10vw; line-height: 1;"]] Show Name [[/span]]@@
@@[[span style="font-size:2.1em;"]] Show description, 1-2 sentences. @@
@@[[/span]]@@
@@@@ @@@@
@@[[span style="font-size:1.1em;"]] Limited Engagement Only. (Where tickets can be bought.)[[/span]]@@
@@[[/div]]@@
[[/div]]

If you want to use this outside of the Queerstyle Theme, you must include the following code:
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Vast+Shadow&display=swap');@@
@@.pseudo-div {@@
@@    border:solid 4px #B22A2A;@@
@@    background:#403450;@@
@@    color: #ffffff;@@
@@    padding: 5px 10px;@@
@@    margin-bottom: 10px;@@
@@    font-family: "Vast Shadow", serif;@@
@@    text-align: center;@@
@@}@@
@@ @@
@@.pseudo-div :is(h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6) {@@
@@    font-family: "Vast Shadow", serif;@@
@@    letter-spacing: 0px;@@
@@    font-weight: normal;@@
@@    color: white;@@
@@}@@
[[/div]]
-----
++ Scene Transistions

Within video logs of Pseudogenesis Performances, transitions between scenes is communicated using this static transition.

[[div class="staticTransition"]]
[[/div]]

To include this, you will need to add the following code to your CSS Module:
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@.staticTransition {@@
@@    background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/pseudogenesis-productions-hub/Vhs_Glitch-cropped-flipped.gif);@@
@@    background-position-x: center;@@
@@    background-clip: border-box;@@
@@    width: 100%;@@
@@    height: 4em;@@
@@    overflow: hidden;@@
@@    background-size: cover;@@
@@    padding: 0em 1.5em;@@
@@    margin-left: -1.5em;@@
@@}@@
[[/div]]

To include the static image within a log, you need to add:
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@[[div class="staticTransition"]]@@
@@[[/div]]@@
[[/div]]

If the image doesn't extend to the edges of the border, or it clips outside of them, you will need to fiddle with the 'padding' and 'margin-left', increasing or decreasing them as needed. Make sure that the two numbers are the same!

> Note: A standard blockquote uses 1.1em instead of the 1.5em.

-----
++ Logo

The logo can be found at the following url:
[[div class="queerbox_large" style="text-align:left; padding-left: 1em;"]]
@@https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/pseudogenesis-productions-hub/Pseudogenesis_Logo_Flatter.png@@
[[/div]]
